channel.title: CyberNetSec - Mobile Security
channel.description: Latest mobile security threat intelligence - the last 10 articles

item.title: Qualcomm Issues January Security Bulletin Addressing Multiple Vulnerabilities
item.description:
Qualcomm has published its January 2026 security bulletin, addressing multiple vulnerabilities of varying severities across a wide range of its products. The bulletin was highlighted by an advisory from the Canadian Centre for Cyber Security on January 7, 2026. Given the ubiquitous nature of Qualcom...

Severity: High

Categories: Patch Management, Vulnerability, Mobile Security

Read Full Article →

item.title: Flaws in Airoha Bluetooth Chips Expose Headphones from Sony, Bose to Hijacking
item.description:
A set of critical vulnerabilities has been disclosed in Bluetooth System-on-Chips (SoCs) from Airoha, a major supplier for popular headphone brands including Sony, Bose, and JBL. The flaws, tracked up to CVE-2025-20702, exist in an unauthenticated diagnostic protocol called RACE. An attacker within ...

Severity: High

Categories: Vulnerability, IoT Security, Mobile Security

Read Full Article →

item.title: New MacSync Malware Dropper Bypasses macOS Gatekeeper with Apple Notarization
item.description:
A new campaign is distributing the MacSync information-stealing malware using a dropper that successfully bypasses Apple's macOS Gatekeeper security feature. The malicious installer is packaged as a disk image for a fake messaging app, and crucially, has been both digitally signed and notarized by A...

Severity: High

Categories: Malware, Cyberattack, Mobile Security

Read Full Article →

item.title: New WhatsApp Hijack Method Bypasses 2FA via SIM Swapping Attacks
item.description:
On December 21, 2025, security researchers highlighted a growing attack method used to hijack WhatsApp accounts that bypasses traditional authentication measures. The technique relies on SIM swapping, where attackers use social engineering to convince a victim's mobile carrier to transfer their phon...

Severity: High

Categories: Phishing, Threat Actor, Mobile Security

Read Full Article →

item.title: Warning: "GhostPairing" Attack Hijacks WhatsApp Accounts with Malicious QR Codes
item.description:
A new social engineering campaign dubbed "GhostPairing" is exploiting WhatsApp's multi-device linking feature to hijack user accounts. India's CERT-In has issued a high-severity warning about the attack, which tricks victims into scanning a malicious QR code or entering a pairing code from a fraudul...

Severity: High

Categories: Phishing, Mobile Security, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: Apple Rushes iOS 26.2 Update to Patch Two Actively Exploited Zero-Days
item.description:
Apple has released an emergency security update, iOS 26.2 and iPadOS 26.2, to address 26 vulnerabilities. Among these are two critical zero-day flaws, CVE-2025-43529 and CVE-2025-14174, both residing in the WebKit browser engine. The company confirmed reports that these vulnerabilities have been act...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management, Mobile Security

Read Full Article →

item.title: SmartTube App Compromised: Malicious Update Pushed via Stolen Keys
item.description:
A significant supply chain attack has compromised the popular ad-free YouTube client for Android TV, SmartTube. An attacker stole the developer's signing keys and distributed a malicious update containing surveillance-style malware through official channels. The malware, hidden in versions 30.43 thr...

Severity: High

Categories: Supply Chain Attack, Malware, Mobile Security

Read Full Article →

item.title: India Backs Down on Mandatory Pre-Installed Government "Snooping App"
item.description:
Following widespread criticism from privacy advocates and significant resistance from major tech companies, the Indian government has withdrawn a controversial directive that would have required smartphone makers like Apple and Samsung to pre-install a non-deletable, state-owned security app. The ap...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Regulatory, Mobile Security

Read Full Article →

item.title: Urgent Android Update: Google Patches 107 Flaws, Two Zero-Days Under Active Attack
item.description:
Google has issued its December 2025 Android security bulletin, patching a total of 107 vulnerabilities. The update is critical, as it addresses two high-severity zero-days, CVE-2025-48633 (Information Disclosure) and CVE-2025-48572 (Elevation of Privilege), which are under limited, targeted exploita...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management, Mobile Security

Read Full Article →

item.title: New 'Nova Stealer' Malware Targets macOS Crypto Wallets
item.description:
A new information-stealing malware, dubbed 'Nova Stealer,' has been discovered actively targeting Apple macOS users. The malware's primary goal is the exfiltration of sensitive data, with a specific focus on cryptocurrency wallets. Nova Stealer operates as a trojan, infecting systems by replacing le...

Severity: High

Categories: Malware, Threat Intelligence, Mobile Security

Read Full Article →
